content.question: Consider the curve defined by −8x2 + 5xy + y3 = −149 . (a) Find <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39D1@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text: Consider the curve defined by −8x2 + 5xy + y3 = −149 . (a) Find <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39D1@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(b) Write an equation for the line tangent to the curve at the point <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mn> 4 </mn> <mo> ,  </mo> <mo> − </mo> <mn> 1 </mn> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> .

(c) There is a number k so that the point <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mn> 4.2 </mn> <mo> ,  </mo> <mi> k </mi> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> is on the curve. Using the tangent line found in part (b), approximate the value of k .

(d) Write an equation that can be solved to find the actual value of k so that the point <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mn> 4.2 </mn> <mo> ,  </mo> <mi> k </mi> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> is on the curve.
(e) Solve the equation found in part (d) for the value of k.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
